website_summaries.verdict: One of the best budget options to upgrade your car's stereo system and music playback in an affordable way.
pros: Accepts a wide variety of different media formats for music playback
Includes a built-in CD player and USB port for direct playback
The Bluetooth audio streaming will work with most smart devices with little setup
cons: Connectivity with wireless remote is spotty and unreliable at times

customer_reviews.title: Good Head Unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive double din head unit. It has basic functions, but works as it should. You can't ask a much for the price. Pros: Bluetooth connects instantly, and you can skip songs strait from the unit, and you can change the colors to match your dash. Cons: The mic could be better for making calls, it's quite, and there is no dimmer on this unit, so it can be bright at night.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F.

customer_reviews.title: ... unit in my truck that was starting to go bad, so i decided to explore amazon for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an old JVC unit in my truck that was starting to go bad, so i decided to explore amazon for a good replacement. The wiring harness that comes with this actually has labels on each individual wire so you dont have to keep referring to the instruction booklet like most radios. I got it installed in about 20 minutes. The sound difference blew me away, for the price this thing performs like a 150+ unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Eric Russ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio at  an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a radio for my old truck and this was perfect! It's got Bluetooth for hands free phone calls or streaming music from your phone. It plays cds,the radio picks up well, has a USB port and an auxiliary in port, and will read small sd cards! Even has a remote control! It was easy to install. Made my old 1978 truck feel thirty years younger!
customer_reviews.author: T Coe

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: For the 53 bucks this is the best bang for your buck, I've read other reviews that people left and it's just a bunch a b.s. it works perfectly .the Bluetooth connects automatically and starts to play the music without me pressing any buttons .making calls isnt the best but it gets the job done .couldnt asked for a better radio & for 50 bucks it's a steal ,don'the really know why people are complaing
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Blue tooth connection is amazing to his iPhone 7
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 1 year later product is still amazing! Definite for the price! See original review: My son purchased this to replace his radio in his Pontiac Grand Prix. He loves it! Blue tooth connection is amazing to his iPhone 7. He can receive calls, play music, and make calls all hands free. Lights up and looks sharp! Great price point, too.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit , very easy to install.,
customer_reviews.text: If you are an audiophile or want a higher end stereo then this probably isn't for you. If you need a a stereo with decent features at a very good price then this is one I would recommend. Mine was a breeze to install in my 2006 Silverado. I was replacing another Boss unit and the plugs were exactly the same. Unplug one, plug the other in, done. The Bluetooth is very handy for answering the phone while driving and the display is nice and big. The variable colors are nice to have, a brighter color in the day and a more subdued one at night keep the unit easy to view in all conditions.
customer_reviews.author: John Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: What are people whining about?
customer_reviews.text: For the price, one day delivery and a 1 year warranty, I don't get it. I wired it up, and it works right off the bat. It sounds just fine. Of course for 46 bucks, it's not going to blow your windows out, or sound like $10,000 dollars. I got it so I could play my phones music library, and it does that just fine. I haven't tried making any calls yet. The packaging left much to be desired though. They just slapped a shipping label on the outside of the original box.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: It'll burn your eyes out
customer_reviews.text: -All the colors are way to bright except the red, no control over the brightness that I can find. -install isn't quite flush, so the stereo sticks out about 1/4 inch. -Built in mic sucks, no one can hear me unless I'm shouting at the top of my lungs and you can't install an external mic. -Clock doesn't show when system is idle or off. have to push a button to get to the clock. Doesn't hold the time, but that could be my fault. On the positive side, the sound is good, if they fixed the above issues I'd be happier w/ the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Yonny B

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Sony instead!  Two units, neither worked correctly.
customer_reviews.text: After six months, my Boss 508UAB began to lose its memory. The presets would be gone, then the clock would lose time, and the beep on/off was intermittent. I received a replacement from boss, and to my surprise, the harness connections are different for the same model! I had to rewire the entire CD player! To make it worse, the replacement does not remember the last volume setting and defaults to 20, which is fairly loud. So, if I forget to turn off the CD player before shutting of my car, I get blasted when I start my car. Boss 508UAB is Garbage. Buy yourself a nice Sony from Crutchfield instead.
customer_reviews.author: ml

customer_reviews.title: but it is a good deal. The Bluetooth works well for playing music ...
customer_reviews.text: It may not be the fanciest stereo out there, but it is a good deal. The Bluetooth works well for playing music off your phone. I only have two gripes - the digital balance controls are not fine enough - sometimes the setting I want is between "zero" and "one" and it doesn't do decimals. The other gripe is that, when playing from a USB drive, "random" seems to usually play the same "random" order... as in, not 1-2-3-4-5 but 3-140-79-20-50... every time you put in the same stick and hit random, it'll usually play in the same non-sequential order. But apart from that, really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H. Legate

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Received my radio this morning and installed it in a 2002 Buick Rendezvous. Sounds good even with factory speakers. Took me 5 hours to do the job because I had no vehicle wiring info, and there were 26 wires going into the factory unit. With a little trial and error got it done. Minor problem...the remote on the Boss doesn't work. Possible bad battery. But I'm happy with the radio.
customer_reviews.author: R. Downing

customer_reviews.title: Could have picked a little better
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of the lack of randomizing for songs from USB or Flashcard. I have a massive collection of music so put my favorites from each type of music (pop, edm, rock, country, ect) on one or two 32gb usb drives for each type. Secondly I haven't found a way to dim the brightness of the neon. It's a cool effect but I do a lot of night driving and have been stopped twice now because the officers thought I had a phone in my hand lighting up my face. No Sir...just the radio. (warnings both times thankfully) Other than that though? Great radio to have and use.
customer_reviews.author: Failtelorn

customer_reviews.title: fits pretty good
customer_reviews.text: 2003 Toyota RAV4 was a quick install thanks to a prior post that included the items needed,Metra 95-8202 Toyota DDIN Multi Dash Kit and Metra 70-1761 Radio Wiring Harness For Toyota 87-Up Power 4 Speaker .It was a pretty straight forward install,you just need to take your time trimming the existing radio bezel.Looks good and sounds good.I live in the sierra foothills and I was able to pull in a lot more stations.Remote didn't work even after changing the battery,I didn't return because I never use them in the car
customer_reviews.author: Greg G.

customer_reviews.title: Could be a great inexpensive radio.
customer_reviews.text: Yes this is a inexpensive radio, but my main issue with it is that it occasionally stops working and either have to unplug the radio or disconnect the battery. It will sometimes not light up and act as the key is off or the blue backlight will stay on until its unplugged or battery is disconnected. If it happens and you park it for a couple days it could drain your battery if you dont catch it. Otherwise its a nice radio, bluetooth works good, phone calls are decent for no external mic. Also noticed the clock wont stay set after shutting the car down.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have given this a 4 plus rating based on its price as it will not compare to higher-end models. It has several very nice features: remote, Bluetooth (the volume will have to be turned up here), USB connectivity and a DVD player. I had to adjust the Bass and Treble but that needs to be handled on any system that you purchase. This is actually the second Boss system that I purchased and frankly, I wasn't that impressed with the first one. I just went with the same system because I did not want to change out the wiring and brackets that I had already installed. To be truthful I made a very good decision.
customer_reviews.author: Vince_A

customer_reviews.title: Stereo Sounds & Looks Great! Bluetooth Lacking!
customer_reviews.text: Installing wasn’t too bad. Although, the wiring diagram was a little confusing at first. Mine was combined with a Boss amplifier. As a result, the install was a little more complicated than a standard install. The stereo sounds great, and I love the RGB light display! My only disappointment is the sound of the hands free Bluetooth calling. I can hear others fine. However, they tell me that I sound like I’m talking to them in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: usb inputs Can call through Bluetooth Easy install Lots of color options Cons
customer_reviews.text: It's a $30 radio I didn't expect much. Pro. Aux, Bluetooth, usb inputs Can call through Bluetooth Easy install Lots of color options Cons. Display will not stay on clock. Calling with Bluetooth isn't very clear. Doesn't pick up stations quite as well Overall I have had it for a few months and it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall proposition of the product. Very efficient, meaning that it is cheap and functional. Truth is, nowadays, for delivering the chachachas and lalalas, we use our smartphones. The car stereo has to deliver a good Bluetooth experience (easy setup, easy link) and a good sound quality. This stereo delivers a flawless BT experience. The sound quality, while not perfect, is very good. To improve the sound quality, you may need better complements (amplifiers and speakers), since I don't think this stereo will be the quality bottleneck. I have just installed the device, installation was easy with standardized connectors and screws. Let's if remains solid in the next weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Joao Poneis

customer_reviews.title: Still working
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one to buy low end and cheap electronics but this head unit has surprised me. Bluetooth hooks up very easily. Easier than my Kenwood Excelon. It does have a weird code that’s on the display usually but that doesn’t bother me. It’s only running two 4” Vega’s because I have my 6.5” on my amp. Recommend this one over other cheap ones because this has the most features for the money. The Bluetooth works with calls as well but going down the highway in an 86 pick-up you can’t be heard very well by the other person because of road noise. Driving down streets it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cal4wh

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck but not very feature rich
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck if you just want to get a double din. Leaves a lot to be desired considering other modern double din radios. There is no touchscreen on the device so one star for that rating. The remote works but it’s a car stereo completely unnecessary in my opinion. Sound quality is okay could be better but for the price not bad. Pros it’s a double din don’t have to have a weird radio slot below your single din. Cons no full display, which means no backup camera functionality, no apple car play or android auto
customer_reviews.author: David Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and great price
customer_reviews.text: For $50 this seems to be an awesome stereo! It has a great sound and great options including Bluetooth which I love! None of our vehicles are new enough that I can play my music from my phone through our stereos. This inexpensive stereo is Bluetooth, yes! So an update to my review, the stereo quit working. Now this is in my jeep wrangler, which is kind of a bumpy ride. My husband has not had time to try to figure it out at this point. I hope he can get it going because I’m really happy with it other than the fact that quit! :(
customer_reviews.author: missusms

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: Lost a star because you can't keep the clock up, every time you want to see the time you have to tap the button. That sux. AND you can't manually tune your stations ! There is a weak signal near me of a local broadcast @ 87.7 and because the signal is so weak it passes it right up, even though old radios have no problem picking it up. Using it to make calls.... the sound from the radio is GREAT... But the person on the other end that hears ME talking says it sounds like I am talking from a speaker phone on the other side of the room.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Azz

customer_reviews.title: Bad software installed!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t Buy! It has 2 subwoofer preAmp rca jacks for Left side & Right side but you cannot control it from the Deck. You cannot use your treble & bass control features while using built in equalizer. You cannot use the equalizer features while using bass & treble features. Sound quality is very bad using the equalizer or with out It. It is a good looking deck with the nice assorted neon lights and all the right hardware features it offers but it has the wrong software installed to really take advantage what the hardware could of really done for the listener.
customer_reviews.author: Desi Carmona

customer_reviews.title: Average.
customer_reviews.text: Installed fairly easy. With the adapter plates and plugs into a 99 Jeep Cherokee XJ. All new 250 Watt Pioneer speakers. Sounds OK. Bluetooth is hard for the person to hear you. No remote Mic. So you kind of have to tell at the radio. But for the average price of a Bluetooth radio with CD. You will get an average sounding radio and hands free audio. So you do get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install in my case. Works well, phone feature works better than expected without an external microphone. Only thing I don't like is the buttons are so small I cannot read what they are for, but the are fitting a lot of features in a relativity small area. Overall it was a very inexpensive replacement for my stock radio and worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE HASSEL OF RE WIREING .
customer_reviews.text: In the description they DO NOT tell you that an adaptor is not available for this radio and the nearest thing will not allow you to properly without a modification to wire the radio to a Colorado Chevrolet 2005 ! With some of the adapters it has an extra hot wire but you will loose a lot of the teachers . NOT WORTH THE HASSEL .
customer_reviews.author: LEON F.GOBLE

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the $$$$$$
customer_reviews.text: There is no touchscreen for this model but for the $$$$ u can't beat it has many features that more expensive radios have at a fraction of the price has 4 color background you can switch at will purple,red,blue,green for me it was great dont need nav,you tube ,back up camera ect I'm distracted enough with just a radio
customer_reviews.author: joe miller

customer_reviews.title: Obviously refurbished crap
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing nearly caught on fire once it was attached and ready to go. I've installed car stereos on every vehicle I have owned, including this one and never had a problem. So far i have had to hunt down 3 fuses that were destroyed and an adapter that is completely destroyed. By the end of this, I am going to have to spend so much more than i spent in the first place because it is looking like i will have to rewire my whole stereo system. I've never seen anything like it and I'm just glad I unplugged it before it caught my car on fire.
customer_reviews.author: ashley patridge

customer_reviews.title: Engine rpm can be heard whining during playback and filter doesn't get rid of it.
customer_reviews.text: You get what your pay for I guess. Who would believe that in 2019 a newly manufactured stereo would be humming/whining along with the engine rpm. This is terrible. Now I have to buy a filter. Update, the filter is unable to clean the humm out. No other deck hums so this deck is trash. The radio plays fine, the CD player takes long to resume playing after engine start. Bluetooth connects quickly and music playback is good. USB playback is good. Calls work but mic is on deck face so one has to shout.
customer_reviews.author: Ike Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival, such a disappointment...
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Man this thing was such a embarrassment. I bought this for my girlfriend's old car that she's gonna replace soon so she could have something to listen to for a few months as a surprised. Hooked up everything and to see the disappointment in her face crushed me. Unit was dead everything hooked up correctly with the correct adaptors. Constant power and accessory but this piece a crap would not turn on. Dang amazon you like me down on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Basic Bluetooth stereo
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a faulty Bluetooth stereo I had in my car. I don’t need a lot of bells and whistles. I just need it to have a radio and have Bluetooth connectivity. And it has both. It is true that the time doesn’t stay on the screen all the time. You have to hit the clock button to see it. Isn’t a big deal to me. I paid $45 bucks for it and it is working great. No CD player either. But I don’t know the last time I used a CD.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After not having a radio in my 2003 Honda Accord for 10 years, I was excited to have my husband install this radio. Worked great the first day. Sounded awesome. Looked great. Only paid $60 for it. The very next day I started the car and radio was lit up but nothing was on the display and no sound. We pressed every button, turned the car off and on and nothing. Uninstalled the radio immediately and sent back. No hassle. I was disappointed because the radio looked good and sounded good. I had never heard of this brand before either.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: worked great for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about 6 months. Car had maintenance that required battery disconnect. Car stereo no longer put out sound after the battery was reconnected. Everything seemed to work but no sound. As it happened when serviced they checked out wiring, checked if another radio would put out sound to the amplifier built into car (that worked) and got on the phone with BOSS support. Diagnosed that car stereo was bad. Even if can get replaced under warranty, have no time to put a new radio in before college student driving car leaves for summer job. May have to put old OEM radio back in for summer. Otherwise was happy with this car stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Walker

customer_reviews.title: Had a few issues, but it's okay...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my 2006 Chevy Equinox and first of all, it was a little small so I had to purchase a new thing so go around the radio to make it look better. And second, the clock resets to 12:00 am everytime I start my car. Really frustrating because I like to know the time while I'm driving. Lastly, when installing, it messed up the lights so now when I open my doors at night the light dont come on like they are supposed to so when it's dark out it's hard to fine the whole to put my key in...
customer_reviews.author: Jarica Sexton

customer_reviews.title: don't buy !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The boss audio has a problem...Just a few minutes after the switch..monitor doesn't work.. after reset works few minutes and after has same problem..
customer_reviews.author: badkid

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth works great, other features are so so
customer_reviews.text: This product was bought with the intention of finding a cheap solution to add Bluetooth to my car. The Bluetooth works great and connects no problem and plays whatever audio I want. Other options: FM/AM receiver isn't very good and doesn't pick up some channels the original headunit does Can't adjust brightness of headunit Aux works ok Haven't tried the USB port but the USB door is flimsy Original post said it had sub out but it didn't, only high and low You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Pham

customer_reviews.title: Good but it's definitely a $50 radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is good for the money. There are a few draw backs. It’s cheaply made, so don’t expect super high quality. I put it in a old truck that I don’t drive often and it’s fine for that. Bluetooth is in and out. Buttons stick a little. Just feels cheap. I put this in a double din size whole and had to get a file and take the whole down another 1/8” to fit it in, so I don't know if the radio is alittle bigger than double din or if the whole in the 98 ford ranger was slightly to small. Hands free calling, the mic is crap so don't expect new car quality.
customer_reviews.author: D.Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Boss after market radio not holding up...
customer_reviews.text: First I like the brand name...Boss known for awesome sounds. 2nd like the price, 3rd easy installation. However, after bout 2 weeks or so...the sound started to fade, lost sounds in 1-2 of my speakers, remote sometimes work. I wondering now if it was actually a good buy or not. I stay busy so I dnt hv the time to have anyone to look at it and my return window has closed. I guess I'm stuck with it and lost money. Boss factory radios may be good...but so far I cannot say the same for their after market radios🤔
customer_reviews.author: Vina

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn your vehicles wiring
customer_reviews.text: The colors are bright then dull, cannot pick what color it just rotates through them. It does not fit a 2002 trailblazer! It asked me to review the touch screen....it doesn’t have one. Self installation was a nightmare because 1. It does not fit a trailblazer, unless you make it fit. 2. The data bus thing sucksssss. I suggest you get the overly pricey harness and not the cheap one, unless you want to tap/piggy back into the fuse panel. I wouldn’t purchase this item again. My previous Boss stereo I purchased for the other blazer worked out well though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio for the price
customer_reviews.text: Install is easy. This is a non-canbus radio so it can go in any vehicle or RV. The factory settings for the sound are not all that good so don't make a snap judgement when you first power it on as it sounds much, much better after you have adjusted. We have an RV with an TV that has a USB and 3.5mm sound jack out to which we attach a small plugin Bluetooth transmitter. The radio connects to it automatically without additional steps and the sound has good separation and adequate volume. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SilverFoxDan

customer_reviews.title: the phone mic is useless, no one can here you
customer_reviews.text: the display shows what mode you are in, e.g. blue tooth, AUX, FM, you have to push a button to show time, I know what mode I am in I would rather have the time, the phone mic is useless, no one can here you, the volume turns itself down every time you shut off the car, and the clock is always off 4 to 5 hours ever time you shut off the car, it always has to be reset. it is a shame you can't give it a '0' star. you get what you pay for, don't waist your money...
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: There is an internal board problem where the radio will ...
customer_reviews.text: There is an internal board problem where the radio will lose its clock time randomly when the car is off. Some weeks it doesn't happen, some times it does. My old radio never lost its clock time, so I know its a problem with this unit that I received. Doesn't bother me much though, as I always have it in bluetooth mode and my phone mounted to the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March. Since having it, there have been multiple glitches and as of a couple days ago, the touch screen doesn't work at all. The multiple glitches include Bluetooth connection not working and the screen not even lighting up. I fixed these glitches by turning the car off and on again. If you want to invest in a new head unit, I do not recommend this one whatsoever and suggest spending more money on better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Too weak and light for it not to vibrate while engine is on, causes strong staticky white noise throughout car while volume is on. Froze a few times on the road and let out a piercing beeeeeeeeeep for like 30 seconds before completely shutting off and starting up a few minutes later. Took it back, got one from pioneer for 90 that works great
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: After hooking this up inside my vehicle, I now have a "whirring" noise in my sound system. I can only assume this thing is so cheaply made that there are no resistors or low quality resistors inside the radio. It's SUPER ANNOYING! But, we are going to try to remedy the issue with either another ground wire, or just buy a better radio. UGH.....
customer_reviews.author: Kandy M. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this stereo about 6 weeks now. It works fine except that it loses power every couple weeks and I have to press the "reset" button (sticking a paper clip into a tiny hole on the face) which deletes all my programmed radio stations and of course resets the clock. It's great except for this stupid reset problem.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Gee

customer_reviews.title: Good Stereo for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's car for Christmas, it works well and he really loves the bluetooth connection. Sound is fine for what he needs it for. Not really sure the need for a remote... and the only real issue worth mentioning is that the buttons are so small his bigger fingers have a hard time hitting some of them. Maybe that is why the remote, but if you are driving and just want to push the next button, you dont want to be fishing around for a remote. He's gotten used to it though and is overall happy; we still recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Budget Stereo
customer_reviews.text: At first the Item was taught to be defective but after further inspection turns out I had it faulty Fuse but after it was rectified the system performance has been outstanding also I a bit of advice since the microphone for Bluetooth hands-free calling is built-in to the device while driving the persons on the other end would hear the road Vibrations but I have rectified the noise feedback by using noise reduction foam around the din wish improved my audio quality at least 80% overall this is a great budget car stereo .
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It looks good, sounds good, easily installed with labeled wires, standard size, Bluetooth easily connects and is automatic after the first time, calls are simple Cons: I can only get the clock to display temporarily and while playing Bluetooth it just says A2DP like I care what that is all the time but I really don't. I'd rather see a song title or the clock. -1 star for that. Overall I like it but probably would've bought one that shows the clock if I would've known.
customer_reviews.author: orangetriangle

customer_reviews.title: Remote never worked
customer_reviews.text: The sound system is nice, I love the lights, it really illuminates especially in the night. When playing a USB you can't tell how many sounds are on a folder, all the tracks on the flash drive show up on the screen. However the biggest pet peeve for me is that the remote never worked, at first I thought that it was that the battery probably needed changing, so I bought a new battery and still, it has never worked since I got it.
customer_reviews.author: greer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. More powerful than my old stereo. Installed in '02 Honda Accord.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: Sound is as good as you can expect at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted something with an aux port but for the price was surprised to find I got a lot more. Bluetooth works so well I no longer use the aux port. Sound is as good as you can expect at this price point. The large volume button is nice when driving. Mute button is in just the right spot also. I don't think you will find a better unit for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick I

customer_reviews.title: Fits well with little modification on a 1999 Miata. bluetooth doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to make fit very easily in my 1999 miata. It's a basic double din bluetooth unit. However the bluetooth only works for about 2 minutes and cuts out. I also can't stream my iPhone via USB, so I have to use an Aux cord. Which is fine, but pretty dissapointing considering I bought a Bluetooth unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Ashba

customer_reviews.title: It’s good for the price. But...
customer_reviews.text: This stereo is better than I expected for a cheap stereo. It connects to Bluetooth easier than any other stereo I’ve ever had which is sweet. ! But it is pretty cheap looking and feeling compared to say a 100$ kenwood or something. Only think I really dislike is the microphone for making phone calls is horrible nobody can ever hear what I’m saying I have to disconnect and talk into the phone and it makes a buzzing sound when not playing music
customer_reviews.author: Forrest24

customer_reviews.title: Not stellar, but not terrible
customer_reviews.text: So, the biggest pro to this unit is that you can change the color settings at your leisure, which is great because I do a lot of driving at night and the red setting is dim enough that it doesn't bother me while doing so. The microphone DOES NOT have good sound quality. I've tested it with and without my car engine running and the difference is so minor that I may as well just leave someone n speaker phone and hope for the best. The CD player and Bluetooth do bug out occasionally, but they're easy to fix. All in all, if you're short on cash and don't have a radio, this one serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't display the clock as the main screen which is stupid. And whenever I set the clock, which is a pain in the ass to do, within a day the clock is completely wrong. The built in mic for calls is horrible and picks up nothing but car noise so the people on the other side can't hear you at all. But if your looking for something just to connect your phone to for maps or music it works great.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: fits F250
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Ford F250 double din just fine. You can buy a kit for easier install or with a few modifications install just by itself. Do note that you'll need to make a slightly larger cut out in the dash of your Ford truck --this is true with any aftermarket double din unit though.
customer_reviews.author: roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Great headunit, works and sounds good.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend Crutchfield.com to see about installing one of these in your vehicle, makes everything super simple. Easy to install with only slight modification in my 2005 Ford Escape w/ factory subwoofer. Sounds amazing and has plenty of bass with factory set up. Easy to use once you're use to the lay-out. Touchscreen very responsive. 9.5/10
customer_reviews.author: Aj Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for price
customer_reviews.text: Nice,cheap radio that works well. Sounds very nice with stock speakers. You can connect a amp and sub as well. Has Aux, Bluetooth,and plays songs on micro SD and flash drive. Has fm radio as well. I use micro SD and the little door closes so you don't have anything sticking out or showing. Great stereo for a person needing something cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Round Pooh Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Great Features, Amazing Price... Only One Down Side.
customer_reviews.text: This stereo was super easy to install and produces some great sound for the price. My one grip is the USB does not recognize either of my iPhones; the USB works and provides a charge, but alas no sound through it. Considering the price and the available Blue Tooth or Aux In connections it's a minor issue. Overall, for the price, you can't beat the value, the sound, or the features it has.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hamilton

customer_reviews.text: I've bought four of these and three of them have been lemons... my first one that I bought in 2017 is still working great, the second one I put in a truck that I sold (it wasn't working 100% of the time either), the third I put in my mom's BMW and it never worked (just lit up and pretended to play something), the fourth was in my sisters jeep and it worked for about 6 months before the display started staying on after the key was off... maybe it's because mine is an older style and when they updated it got worse?? idk, I'm not planning on buying anymore of these head units...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So good I’ll probably get a spare.
customer_reviews.text: How can something so great be so cheap? FORTY TWO DOLLARS! It cost me a lot more to have it installed but I love it. Great FM. Great cd/mp3. USB can charge or take a memory stick. Very easy to navigate and use. Has auxiliary input. Audio shop installed it in 12 minutes. Great unit! Oh yeah the back lighting is very cool.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazon, great service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stereo for my chevy truck 2001 but unfortunately it did not fit when I try to return it back I couldn't believe how easy the return procces was. So I about onother one that would fit my truck same brand Boss I been buying alot stuff from Amazon great service I would keep buying through Amazon and I keep recomended to my friend and family coworkers
customer_reviews.author: Miguel T.

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised by this radio, I wasn’t expecting it to work as well as it does. The touchscreen is a bit “laggy” even after I calibrated it but for the price I can’t complain, it took me 10 mins to find the bass and treble settings, but most because I’m apparently blind and didn’t see the icon on top right corner of home screen. Can’t lie it’s a pretty awesome deal actually.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tribuzio

customer_reviews.title: Sounds decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Did not include the part circled in red. Not even sure why it was in the photo because it isn't even mentioned in the user manual. . Also there is no adjustment of any kind for the pre-amp sub output. Other than that, not too bad for the price. The only other issue I have had is that the usb port won't recognize my flash drive sometimes until I power down the unit and restart, and The memory has reset twice already and had to reload stations and settings.
customer_reviews.author: Bennie W.

customer_reviews.title: Best radio out there
customer_reviews.text: Best radio out there. This is my third BOSS radio (not because they break, but because I have several cars) and they all work as good or better than the other more expensive brands. I don't know, but would bet these radio's are made in the same area (China) and probably the same factory as many other expensive brands. If you need a reliable, cheap radio...this is it!
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: This double din will install in astro vans
customer_reviews.text: Good stereo for the price. I installed this double din in a 99 astro van, I used the existing mount,disassembling it from the old radio and buying a scosche gmdasd harness and antenna adapter. So for less than $50.00 I have a double din in the astro van. It goes in fairly easy and not much time, fits snug on top and bottom but has gap on side which I filled with a foam piece
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We put this in my daughter's truck and it couldn't be a more wonderful radio for the price. Set up was easy installation was a piece of cake and my daughter is enjoyed the fun color choices.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R

customer_reviews.title: nice system, fairly easy to
customer_reviews.text: bought a couple of these ,for truck I sold ,,nice system ,fairly easy to install,,keep getting questions will it fit there vehicle,,will fit anything with the right mounting items
customer_reviews.author: mitchell arnold

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: This is not a touch screen unit. Everything about it is great. I previously bought a similar model Duo brand and it was terrible. Once this was installed the sound quality was perfect. It does not tell you song info though like the listing says it does. That was my only complaint. Great stereo for the price.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: I've got to say I'm disappointed but I kind of knew better than to try ...
customer_reviews.text: I've got to say I'm disappointed but I kind of knew better than to try this radio. Ordered in May, and until about a week ago it's been great. Now it shuts on and off, randomly all the time. I've checked connections, ground, 12v source. Everything is good. And I was able to test this while it was acting up. And of course my window to return it was June 10th. Pretty disappointed. Won't make the same mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jenny

customer_reviews.title: The mic is terrible, everything else is ok
customer_reviews.text: I had to drill two holes on each side to get it to fit my 99 Camry original head unit bracket. Other than that it fits well. The light brightness issue that some of the other reviews mention is there, but just setting it on red worked for me. The main issue I have with unit is the built-in microphone. It's sound is terribly low and others can barely hear me speaking. I am having ground loop issues with it, but it might be just my connections.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Allam

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly was Skeptical by the reviews, but honestly for a 19 year old kid with a used car. This is the Best Buy. It works hands-free and he'll of the remote control. I would definitely say you're not losing money for taking a chance on this.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: WOW what a cheap stereo after a couple of weeks of intermittent music coming out of speakers all sound just died. Tested all wires and contacts all tested good except out put from stereo. Should have gone to WalMart .Warning DO NOT BUY. Oh yeah put old stereo back in , it works just fine!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good stereo for price
customer_reviews.text: It's a grate stereo Great Sound puts out enough Bass and is loud the only thing that I did not like about it was when I installed it it did not quite fit lengthwise about a quarter inch on each side and there was no brightness control so most the colors are too little bright at night all in all though it is a very good stereo
customer_reviews.author: Jake!

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: BOSS Audio radios have got to be the best bang for your buck radio. I have purchased the single DIN multiple times, but I needed double DIN to install into my Ford Crown Victoria. It works amazingly to this day! Wiring was easy and straight forward, and they even improved my stock speaker sound. I would choose these over any of the more expensive kind any day.
customer_reviews.author: TheFireFlame01

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother ....
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this deck 2 channels didn't work so sent it back got the same one again had to rewire because the same deck now has different jacks. All that and nothing its broken too. I'm over it ! I put my old one back it works fine. I need a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney F. Treadaway

customer_reviews.title: Cheap radio for cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds ok if it wasn't that it picks up engine electrical noise. I replaced this with a Sony with same wiring adapter and the Sony did not have this issue. Buttons feel a little cheap also. Not a good deal, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: No sound after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I installed the radio when I received it. I have ridden the bike it's on, maybe five times since I bought the radio. I went to show someone who was going to purchase the bike when I got no sound. I removed the fairing, unplugged the antenna, plugged it back in and the sound was working. I put the fairing back on, turned the bike on and no sound again. No sound since then. And of course, no warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Clock doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, but the clock does not keep time. The stereo works otherwise. I don't want to pull the whole thing out to return it. Either way you only see the clock for a few seconds after pushing a button. You can't have it display all the time...
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Price reflects the quality
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth mic is not very good, everyone tells me i sound like im underwater. Engine noise comes thru even properly grounded. Volume comes on very loud during initial power up. Loud popping noise when switching sources. No problems when swapped out with a JVC unit. U get what u paid for. Price definitely reflects the quality.
customer_reviews.author: r. a. h.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. At first it started to lose track of the time, then the screen would half disappear as in the bottom half would be blank in the top half would be scramble digits, now it doesn't turn on at all and the screen stays blank. I verified all power and grounds I know my way around wiring. It's just simply the radio is a piece of crap and quit working. I've had this thing Less Than 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Boss stereo works good
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a Jeep that had a navigation radio. Let me tell you that was a learning experience after reordering the kit and getting a harness adapter because of the amp it all went together and worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Super light weight
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight, then i realized it does not have a CD player within, no issue for me as all i use it for is some better sound in my 03 outback, and all of my music is loaded to a USB drive and it plugs in and plays perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Nice reciever
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have mic input for Bluetooth so no calling feature but i didn't want that anyway. Sounds amazing. USB, AUX, & micro sd card on the face so you don't have to try and figure that mess out, i really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: oldschoolninja

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Awesome with my 6x9 5 Channel pioneers
customer_reviews.text: Sounds Great with my 6x9 5 channel Pioneers just make sure that the fuse on the back is seated properly the stereos amplifier stopped working the day after I installed it and I thought that it had broken I was going to send it back for another when i removed it and examined the unit i pushed on the fuse it made a click noise and has worked perfect since . The customer support was great they had no problem sending me a new unit without having me to send back The wiring harness that i wired each speaker to but didn't end up needing a new unit
customer_reviews.author: GordoDabsOwnlee

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, and I feel like this one was worth it
customer_reviews.text: Overall this unit works well, it does have a slight hissing sound when the volume is supposed to be off. But you get what you pay for and I I didn't want to spend lots of money on the head unit. Overall pretty satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Bugs out a bit turning on off and on again
customer_reviews.text: Great for a double din. Fits perfect in my 2003 VW golf. Only thing is the hello and good bye take a while to turn on so it bugs out if you ignition on and then turn the car of and it turns itself back off
customer_reviews.author: Joe Arthur Angel

customer_reviews.title: Stereo was a lemon...
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up this stereo in my 07 Chevy HHR..it's worked for about a minute with sound and then stopped playing but still has power as the display Wes still working.so I was very disappointed in the stereo.had bought another boss stereo about 4 years ago that's in my Honda and still working..so don't buy this stereo..
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth music work well but not other thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to use with bluetooth music That was the only thing work well. Bluetooth cell phone call did not work . The mic just can not pick up your voice well. Radio antenna signal is weak. And there is a humming noise on the speaker .
customer_reviews.author: fuji

customer_reviews.title: Amazing head unit for the price. Great for new car owners.
customer_reviews.text: For the money that you spend, this head unit will take you far. It not only increases sound quality, it looks great since you can match the led color to anything in the car that you want. I also love the Bluetooth option and the USB charging port. If you want to go on a road trip with the GPS on, connect your phone to the Bluetooth to have music and the GPS audio, and plug your phone in to keep it charged for the whole drive.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Bonomo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, the Bluetooth works great and is a wonderful help. No more trying to get the AUX cord. The auto-syncing of the BT to my phone in one breathe is great and annoying when I am using my BT headset on a phone call and the car wants to take over. Other then that, I am more then pleased with this unit. Such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: M Hall

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you are not committed enough.
customer_reviews.text: This audio system works but it's really hard to put on. It's took me 6 hours to connect all the wire.. u definitely need a wireing herness to get it done easy. The manual is useless and there is few online support.
customer_reviews.author: shareare muhith

customer_reviews.title: Great stereo!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to install. Looks and sounds awesome. Easy to use. Easy to connect via Bluetooth. Once you connect, the stereo will automatically pick up where you left off when you get in and out of your car running errands etc.
customer_reviews.author: Shin Chan!

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is ok but the Bluetooth sucks for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my beater that I drive back and forth to work so I could connect my phone through Bluetooth. Sound quality is ok but the Bluetooth sucks for phone calls. I have to pretty much yell towards the radio so the mic will pick up my voice.
customer_reviews.author: John Brigante

customer_reviews.title: this is a great radio for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had this Radio installed by Audio Zoo because all the old radio and tape player had to be removed. Then used a kit so that the radio could be installed where old tape player was located. Had speakers located in door also. I am very pleased with the radio and installation. Technician told me that he thought this radio sounded as good as radios that cost 3 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if it is too soon to say but I love the car stereo. it has everything I wanted, double bin, Bluetooth, FM radio, USB and memory card player. The only downfalls so far are that I cannot figure out the remote and I am unable to hear the caller when I connect my phone through Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Kerryann

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, the clock thing is a known bummer and the RCAs pretty much require ground loop isolators, but the price is good and it's always a win to get bluetooth in the rusty old truck. I knew what I was getting into so I'm cool with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: you can't beat this seeo for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This stereo is a great value. Easiy to install and easy to use the controls. I have not been able to pick up AM band, but I am still working on that. I think it is my antennae setup, not the unit itself.
customer_reviews.author: Delmar

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I've been installing car radios for years. This has basic features, everything works as it should. Now the bad. There's no way to keep the clock up. Really bad engine noise.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

product_meta.title: Boss Audio Systems 508UAB Multimedia Car Stereo - Single Din, Bluetooth Audio/Hands-Free Calling, Built-in Microphone, CD/MP3/USB/AUX Input, AM/FM Radio Receiver, Wireless Remote Control
product_meta.description: Style:508UAB Multimedia Car StereoDrive on to your next adventure with music to accompany your every turn With the BOSS Audio 508UAB CD/MP3 player. Get your vehicle rocking with the am/FM radio or your favorite CD tracks. Hook up an MP3 player or smartphone to the auxiliary Input or plug into the USB port and blast out your own playlists. Take control with the convenient wireless remote. Bluetooth technology lets you stream audio apps such as Pandora and Spotify and make calls hands-free. The BOSS Audio 508UAB has you covered with quality sound and choice. For further product details, please scroll down. Refer to page 11 in the user manual for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: BLUETOOTH: Answer / make calls and be hands-free with no distractions. The built-in microphone picks up your voice and your car speakers let you hear the person on the other side. Play and control your music and apps like Spotify / Pandora wirelessly

MEDIA PLAYBACK: Play music through your Bluetooth device, pop in a CD or use the USB port. Digital media support include MP3 and WMA file formats. Tune into the AM / FM radio stations for up to date music/news/sports and more
AUXILIARY INPUT: Compatible with the audio output from smartphones as well as MP3 players. Just plug in and start playing
INPUTS: The USB port gives you the option to have a vast library of audio files at your fingertips. The Auxiliary input is a convenient way to hook up to your MP3 player
OUTPUTS: Use front, rear pre-amp outputs to hook up your speakers (front left / front right and rear left / rear right)
EQUALIZER: Customize how you want to hear your music with the balance / fader / bass and treble and control it all with the wireless remote control from either inside or outside of your vehicle
SPECIFICATIONS: Dimensions – 7” x 7” x 2”, Weight – 3.10 Lbs, 50 watts x 4 Max power

WARRANTY: BOSS Audio Systems provides a powerful 3-year Platinum Online Dealer Warranty so long as the purchase is made through Amazon.com. We strongly encourage professional installation of this product to ensure proper and safe functionality

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars3,269 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Vehicle Cd Digital Music Player Receivers
